list.name: Changes
list.comment:
PODMASTER V1
feat: Implement advanced playback and metrics features
- Added skip forward/backward (15s) controls, playlist management, and MP3 title search. - Integrated album art extraction for MP3 files in the player tab. - Introduced usage metrics tracking (played episodes logged to CSV) with a dedicated Metrics tab. - Enhanced UI with detailed per-file download progress (speed, file size, percentage) and custom styled progress bars. - Added multi-user support with login, user-specific podcast configurations, and an admin panel for user management. - Maintained existing functionality (podcast download, storage visualization, activity logging) with improvements.

vrip updated to 1.02.0 rss only massive overhaul written for pyinstaller
vrip updated to 1.02.0 rss only massive overhaul written for pyinstaller

vrip 2.0.0 [Enhanced Update, Verbose Logging, Extended Server Info & File Verification]
A command‑line tool for downloading podcast episodes from RSS feeds. Features: - Uses a configuration file (vrip.ini) to store user info and podcasts. - Podcast list entries are stored as: PODCAST_LINK : NAME_ID : OUTPUT_DIRECTORY - Custom filename formats (default/daily). - Verbose mode shows extended server info (via httpx), download speed, etc. - Automatic timeout handling with exponential backoff and retry. - Update feature now checks every episode and downloads missing ones. - Optional SHA256 integrity hashing (sidecar .sha256 file) and verification. - HTTPS‑only mode option. - Rich table display, status panels with icons, clear banners, and Quiet Mode. - Strong type hints and improved error logging.
Refer to the manual (via the Manual & About menu) for full details.

vrip 2.0.0 [Enhanced Update, Verbose Logging, Extended Server Info & File Verification]
A command‑line tool for downloading podcast episodes from RSS feeds. Features: - Uses a configuration file (vrip.ini) to store user info and podcasts. - Podcast list entries are stored as: PODCAST_LINK : NAME_ID : OUTPUT_DIRECTORY - Custom filename formats (default/daily). - Verbose mode shows extended server info (via httpx), download speed, etc. - Automatic timeout handling with exponential backoff and retry. - Update feature now checks every episode and downloads missing ones. - Optional SHA256 integrity hashing (sidecar .sha256 file) and verification. - HTTPS‑only mode option. - Rich table display, status panels with icons, clear banners, and Quiet Mode. - Strong type hints and improved error logging.
Refer to the manual (via the Manual & About menu) for full details.

prx 2.1.0 [MAJOR UPDATE: Damaged File Checking with 5MB Tolerance] - Added is_file_damaged() to detect incomplete/truncated files. - If local file exists, we compare local size to the feed's 'length' or an HTTP HEAD request. - A 5MB 'TOLERANCE' is used to allow minor mismatches in reported size vs. actual size. - We only re-download if local_size < remote_size - TOLERANCE. - If feed doesn't provide a valid size, or HEAD fails, we assume the file is good.

prx 2.2.0 [All Settings in INI + Window Resizing + Tolerance in MB]
CHANGELOG: - All configurable settings are now read from the INI. - The damaged-file tolerance is specified in MB (default: 5 MB). - Window size (width x height) is read from the INI and applied (Windows only). - You can change any setting (timeouts, retries, tolerance, window size, etc.) via the INI.

prx 2.2.0 [All Settings in INI + Window Resizing + Tolerance in MB]

CHANGELOG: - All configurable settings are now read from the INI. - The damaged-file tolerance is specified in MB (default: 5 MB). - Window size (width x height) is read from the INI and applied (Windows only). - You can change any setting (timeouts, retries, tolerance, window size, etc.) via the INI.

prx 2.2.0 [All Settings in INI + Window Resizing + Tolerance in MB]
CHANGELOG: - All configurable settings are now read from the INI. - The damaged-file tolerance is specified in MB (default: 5 MB). - Window size (width x height) is read from the INI and applied (Windows only). - You can change any setting (timeouts, retries, tolerance, window size, etc.) via the INI.
fixed some stuff
fixed some stuff

refactor: migrate to questionary/curses UI, make config path dynamic via env var
- Replaced outdated menu system with questionary for modern interactive prompts - Added optional curses-based window resizing for Windows - Made config and output paths dynamic via PRX_BASE_DIR env variable - Refactored config handling, download logic, and menus into modular functions - Improved readability, maintainability, and user experience across the app

PODMASTER V1
feat: Implement advanced playback and metrics features
- Added skip forward/backward (15s) controls, playlist management, and MP3 title search. - Integrated album art extraction for MP3 files in the player tab. - Introduced usage metrics tracking (played episodes logged to CSV) with a dedicated Metrics tab. - Enhanced UI with detailed per-file download progress (speed, file size, percentage) and custom styled progress bars. - Added multi-user support with login, user-specific podcast configurations, and an admin panel for user management. - Maintained existing functionality (podcast download, storage visualization, activity logging) with improvements.

vrip 2.0.0 [Enhanced Update, Verbose Logging, Extended Server Info & File Verification]
A command‑line tool for downloading podcast episodes from RSS feeds. Features: - Uses a configuration file (vrip.ini) to store user info and podcasts. - Podcast list entries are stored as: PODCAST_LINK : NAME_ID : OUTPUT_DIRECTORY - Custom filename formats (default/daily). - Verbose mode shows extended server info (via httpx), download speed, etc. - Automatic timeout handling with exponential backoff and retry. - Update feature now checks every episode and downloads missing ones. - Optional SHA256 integrity hashing (sidecar .sha256 file) and verification. - HTTPS‑only mode option. - Rich table display, status panels with icons, clear banners, and Quiet Mode. - Strong type hints and improved error logging.
Refer to the manual (via the Manual & About menu) for full details.

prx 2.1.0 [MAJOR UPDATE: Damaged File Checking with 5MB Tolerance] - Added is_file_damaged() to detect incomplete/truncated files. - If local file exists, we compare local size to the feed's 'length' or an HTTP HEAD request. - A 5MB 'TOLERANCE' is used to allow minor mismatches in reported size vs. actual size. - We only re-download if local_size < remote_size - TOLERANCE. - If feed doesn't provide a valid size, or HEAD fails, we assume the file is good.
